basics.name: Shuai Victor Zhou
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I'm an undergrad student at UC Berkeley studying Computer Science and Mathematics. I come from a background of competitive math, physics, and engineering. In my free time, I enjoy hiking, running, learning languages, creating videos, watching shows, and playing poker.

work.summary: Optimized the Verizon fiber loss workflow by creating a tetherless solution, increasing efficiency and accuracy by 35%. Leveraged BLE, FTP, and Cloud data transfer approaches for field technicians, reducing cost of business by $100k+ across 140M+ served customers annually and increasing functional and strategic KPIs as well as UX metrics. Architected and built a scalable end-to-end vendor agnostic system, enabling direct communication with vendor clouds for a centralized platform of configuration IPIDs and OLTS/OTDR tests that removes reliance on third-party APIs.
Management of internal club logistics, working towards a goal of providing opportunities for everyone to explore the tech industry with a supportive community.

Built the MA-1 portable mercury detector application with data analytics and ran lab tests for the sensors. Worked closely with customers for improving the quality and creating the features to meet their needs. Spearheaded the development and customery discovery for the PA-1 fluid mercury sensor.
Began education at Berkeley, majoring in Computer Science and Mathematics.
Taught competition-level mathematics and advanced topics in the Science Bowl competition to elementary and middle school students.

Conducted research in hybridized Cₙ-Kₙ IO graphs’ traversal heuristics with their relations to inner and outer nodal degrees at Rice University’s Department of Computational and Applied Math under Professor Illya V. Hicks.
Founded my high school's Physics Club. Coordinated volunteering at our local middle school with a specially-curated curriculum of notes and problem sets.
